sen.j: 長束 正家（なつか まさいえ／ながつか まさいえ）は、安土桃山時代の大名であり、豊臣政権の五奉行の一人である。
sen.e: Masaie NATSUKA was the daimyo during the Azuchi-Momoyama period and was the Go bugyo of the TOYOTOMI Administration.
Masaie NATSUKA was a daimyo and member of the Go-Bugyo (Five Commissioners) of the TOYOTOMI Administration during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: the'→'a''was the'→'member of'Added explanation of 'Go-Bugyo'Moved 'during the Azuchi-Momoyama period' to the end
sen.e: Masaie NATSUKA (or NAGATSUKA) was a daimyo and member of the Gobugyo (Five Major Magistrates) of the TOYOTOMI Administration during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: 「なつか」と「ながつか」と2種類の読みがあるようです。

sen.j: 父は長束盛里といわれるが不明。
sen.e: His father is considered to be Morisato NATSUKA but is uncertain.
sen.cmt: 長束盛里→定訳不明, Morisato NATSUKAだと思います。
sen.e: His father is thought to be Morisato NATSUKA but this is uncertain.
His father is thought to be Morisato NATSUKA but this is uncertain.

sen.j: 弟に長束直吉（伊賀守）がいる。
sen.e: His younger brother is Naoyoshi NATSUKA (Iga no Kami).
His younger brother is Naoyoshi NATSUKA (Iga no Kami).
His younger brother is Naoyoshi NATSUKA (Iga no Kami).

sen.j: 近江国水口岡山城主。
sen.e: The lord of Minakuchi Okayama Castle of Omi no Kuni (Omi Province).
He was the lord of Minakuchi Okayama Castle of Omi no Kuni (Omi Province).
He was the lord of Minakuchi Okayama Castle of Omi no Kuni (Omi Province).

sen.j: 一般に長束氏の本姓は大蔵氏とされるが、おそらく官称の大蔵省を氏と誤認したものだろう。
sen.e: It is commonly known that the original family name of NATSUKA clan was Okura clan, but it was probably a misinterpretation of the Okura sho (Ministry of Finance) rank title.
It is commonly thought that the original family name of the NATSUKA clan was OKURA, but this is probably due to mistaking the Okura-sho (Ministry of Finance) for a family name.
sen.cmt: known'→'thought'Capitalized Okura'it was'→'this is''a misinterpretation of'→'due to mistaking''rank title'→'for a family name'
sen.e: It is commonly thought that the original family name of the NATSUKA Clan was OKURA, but this is probably due to mistaking the Okura-sho (Ministry of Finance) for a family name.

sen.j: 永禄5年（1562年）、長束盛里の長男として近江国栗太郡長束村（尾張国説もある）で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the eldest son of Morisato NATSUKA in Natsuka-mura (village), Kurita-gun (District), Omi no Kuni (Owari no Kuni theory is also present).
He was born in Natsuka-mura, Kurita-gun, Omi no Kuni (or maybe in Owari no Kuni) and was the eldest son of Morisato NATSUKA.
sen.cmt: Changed word orderDeleted translations of place names'theory is also present'→'or maybe in'
sen.e: He was born in Natsuka-mura, Kurita-gun, Omi no Kuni (or maybe in Owari no Kuni) and was the eldest son of Morisato NATSUKA.

sen.j: 初め織田氏の家臣・丹羽長秀に仕えたが、天正13年（1585年）に豊臣秀吉の奉公衆に抜擢され、丹羽氏が大減封処分を受けると豊臣氏直参の家臣になった。
sen.e: He first served under the handsman of ODA Family, Nagahide NIWA, but was promoted to be the bugyo jo of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and served as the retainer directly serving TOYOTOMI Family when the estate of NIWA Family was greatly stripped away for a punishment.

He first served the ODA family retainer, Nagahide NIWA, but, in 1585, was promoted to the position of one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's bugyo (commissioner) and, after the NIWA domain was severely reduced as punishment, served the TOYOTOMI family directly as a retainer.
sen.cmt: under the handsman of ODA Family'→'the ODA family retainer''to be the bugyo jo of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI'→'to the position of one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's bugyo'Added translation of 'bugyo'Changed word order
sen.e: He first served the ODA Clan retainer, Nagahide NIWA, but, in 1585, was promoted to the position of one of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's Hokoshu (a military post in Muromachi Shogunate) and, after the NIWA domain was severely reduced as punishment, served the TOYOTOMI Clan directly as a retainer.

sen.j: 高い算術能力を買われて、財政を一手に担い、豊臣氏の蔵入地の管理、太閤検地の実施に当たる。
sen.e: His advanced mathematical ability was regarded highly, and he single handedly handled finances, managed kuraichi (where payment of samurai were handled), and started Taikokenchi (farm land and harvest measurements).

His advanced mathematical ability was highly regarded, and he single handedly handled finances, managed TOYOTOMI's kuraichi (where the payment of samurai was handled), and implemented TOYOTOMI's nationwide land survey (Taikokenchi).
sen.cmt: regarded highly'→'highly regarded'Added 'TOYOTOMI's'Added 'the''were'→'was''started'→'implemented''(farm land and harvest measurements)'→'nationwide land survey'
sen.e: His advanced mathematical ability was highly regarded, and he single handedly handled finances, managed TOYOTOMI's kurairichi (where the payment of samurai was handled), and implemented TOYOTOMI's nationwide land survey (Taikokenchi).

sen.j: 九州征伐・小田原の役・文禄・慶長の役の際には、兵糧奉行として兵糧の輸送に活躍した。
sen.e: In Odawara no Eki (Odawara Campaign) and Bunroku-Keicho no Eki (Korean invasions), he sent food provisions for soldiers as the Hyoro bugyo.
During the Odawara Campaign and Bunroku-Keicho invasions of Korea, he was the commissioner in charge of sending food provisions for soldiers.
sen.cmt: in'→'during'Deleted 'Odawara no Eki', 'no Eki' and brackets'he sent...the Hyoro bugyo'→'he was the commissioner in charge of sending food provisions for soldiers'
sen.e: During the Kyushu Conquest, the Odawara Campaign and Bunroku-Keicho invasions of Korea, he was the Hyoro bugyo in charge of sending food provisions for soldiers.
sen.cmt: 「the Kyushu Conquest」が抜けていた。「commissioner」→「Hyoro bugyo」

sen.j: 文禄4年（1595年）に近江水口岡山城5万石を拝領し（のち加増されて12万石）、五奉行の末席に名を連ねる。
sen.e: He was granted with 50,000 koku Minakuchi Okayama Castle of Omi no kuni (Omi Province) (eventually added to 120,000 koku), and his name was on the lowest seat of Go bugyo.

In 1595 he was given Minakuchi Okayama Castle in Omi no kuni (Omi Province), with an income of 50,000 koku (eventually increased to 120,000 koku), and he was appointed to the lowest position on the Go-Bugyo.
sen.cmt: Added 'in 1595''granted'→'given''of'→'in'Added 'an income of''added'→'increased''his name was on the lowest seat'→'he was appointed to the lowest position on the'
sen.e: In 1595 he was given Minakuchi Okayama Castle in Omi no kuni (Omi Province), with an income of 50,000 koku (eventually increased to 120,000 koku), and he was appointed to the lowest position on the Gobugyo.

sen.j: 秀吉没後は石田三成方に与し、家康打倒の謀議に参加、水口にて会津征伐へ向かう家康の暗殺を謀るも失敗した。
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi, he served on the side of Mitsunari ISHITADA, participated in the Ieyasu impeachment conspiracy, but failed attempted assassination of Ieyasu on his way to suppress Aizu at Minakuchi.

After the death of Hideyoshi, he served Mitsunari ISHIDA and participated in the plot to overthrow Ieyasu as well as in the unsuccessful assassination attempt at Minakuchi on Ieyasu, who was on his way to subjugate Aizu.
sen.cmt: Deleted 'on the side of''in the...at Minakuchi'→'in the plot to overthrow Ieyasu as well as in the unsuccessful assassination attempt at Minakuchi on Ieyasu, who was on his way to subjugate Aizu'
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi, he served Mitsunari ISHIDA and participated in the plot to overthrow Ieyasu as well as in the unsuccessful assassination attempt at Minakuchi on Ieyasu, who was on his way to subjugate Aizu.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）に三成らとともに毛利輝元を擁立して挙兵する。
sen.e: He supported Terumoto MORI with Mitsunari and raised an army in 1600.
In 1600, together with Mitsunari and others, he raised an army to support Terumoto MORI.
sen.cmt: Moved 'in 1600' to start of sentence'He supported...an army'→'together with Mitsunari and others, he raised an army to support Terumoto MORI'
sen.e: In 1600, together with Mitsunari and others, he raised an army to support Terumoto MORI.

sen.j: 初め伊勢の津城を攻略し、関ヶ原の戦いでは毛利秀元・吉川広家とともに南宮山（岐阜県不破郡）に布陣したが、吉川広家の妨害により、毛利秀元や長宗我部盛親とともに本戦に参加できず、西軍壊滅すると敗走した。
sen.e: They first attacked Ise-no-Tsu Castle and gathered in Mt. Nangu (Fuwa-gun (district), Gifu Prefecture) with Hidemoto Mori and Hiroie KIKKAWA in the Battle of Sekigahara, but could not attend the main battle with Hidemoto MORI and Morichika CHOSOKABE due to the interfering Hiroie KIKKAWA and escaped when the Western Army fell.

They first attacked Ise-no-Tsu Castle and then, during the Battle of Sekigahara, joined up with Hidemoto MORI and Hiroie KIKKAWA at Mt. Nangu (Fuwa-gun, Gifu Prefecture) but KIKKAWA blocked them and Morichika CHOSOKABE from joining the main battle and they fled after the collapse of the Western Army.
sen.cmt: Rewrote sentence though not sure it makes much more sense without any background on Sekigahara, especially Kikkawa's actions.
sen.e: They first attacked Ise-no-Tsu Castle and then, during the Battle of Sekigahara, joined up with Hidemoto MORI and Hiroie KIKKAWA at Mt. Nangu (Fuwa-gun, Gifu Prefecture) but KIKKAWA blocked them and Morichika CHOSOKABE from joining the main battle and they fled after the collapse of the Western Army.

sen.j: 水口城を目前に、追手の池田輝政・池田長吉に包囲され、弟長束直吉と共に自刃した。
sen.e: He was surrounded by chasing Terumasa IKEDA and Nagayoshi IKEDA just in front of Minakuchi Castle and committed suicide with his younger brother, Naoyoshi NATSUKA.
He was chased and surrounded by Terumasa IKEDA and Nagayoshi IKEDA just outside Minakuchi Castle, and committed suicide with his younger brother, Naoyoshi NATSUKA.
sen.cmt: surrounded by chasing'→'chased and surrounded''in front of'→'outside'
sen.e: He was chased and surrounded by Terumasa IKEDA and Nagayoshi IKEDA just outside Minakuchi Castle, and committed suicide with his younger brother, Naoyoshi NATSUKA.

sen.j: 享年39という。
sen.e: He died at the age of 39.
He died at the age of 39.
He died at the age of 39.

sen.j: 正室は本多忠勝の一族の栄子。
sen.e: His formal wife was Eiko of Tadakatsu HONDA Family.
sen.cmt: 栄子→Eiko 定訳不明, Eiko と読めると思いますが。
sen.e: His wife was Eiko of the Tadakatsu HONDA Family.
His wife was Eiko of the Tadakatsu HONDA Family.

sen.j: 栄子との間には関ヶ原後に一男が生まれ、のちに水口大徳寺の三世門跡となったという。
sen.e: He had one son with Eiko after Sekigahara who became the third generation monseki (monk) of Minakuchi Daitoku-ji Temple.
He had one son with Eiko after Sekigahara, who became the third monzeki (head priest) of Minakuchi Daitoku-ji Temple.
He had one son with Eiko after Sekigahara, who became the third monzeki (head priest) of Minakuchi Daitoku-ji Temple.

sen.j: このあたり、石田三成の子孫とも似通っており興味深い。
sen.e: It is interesting that this part resembled the descendants of Mitsunari Ishida.
Interestingly, this is similar to the experiences of Mitsunari ISHIDA's descendants.
sen.cmt: It is interesting that'→'Interestingly,''this part resembled the descendants of Mitsunari Ishida'→'this is similar to the experiences of Mitsunari ISHIDA's descendants'
sen.e: Interestingly, this is similar to the experiences of Mitsunari ISHIDA's descendants.

sen.j: 子に長束半右衛門、長束長吉、長束祐順らがいる。
sen.e: His children included Hanemon NATSUKA, Nagayoshi NATSUKA, and Yuujun NATSUKA.
His other children included Hanemon NATSUKA, Nagayoshi NATSUKA, and Yuujun NATSUKA.
His other children included Hanemon NATSUKA, Nagayoshi NATSUKA, and Yujun NATSUKA.

sen.j: 子の半右衛門は細川幽斎の孫の徳雲院を正室としていた縁で細川忠興に召抱えられ、肥後国の地で存続する。
sen.e: Since the formal wife of the son, Hanaemon, was the grand child (Tokuun in) of Yusai HOSOKAWA, he served under Tadaoki HOSOKAWA and continued to live in Higo no kuni (Higo Province).
His son, Hanemon, married Tokuun-in, the grandchild of Yusai HOSOKAWA, served under Tadaoki HOSOKAWA and continued to live in Higo no kuni (Higo Province).
sen.cmt: Removed 'a' from 'Hanaemon''Since the formal wife of the son'→'His son married'
sen.e: His son, Hanemon, married Tokuun-in, the grandchild of Yusai HOSOKAWA, served under Tadaoki HOSOKAWA and continued to live in Higo no kuni (Higo Province).

sen.j: 子孫は田中氏を名乗った。
sen.e: The descendant took the name of TANAKA Family.
His descendants took the name TANAKA.
His descendants took the name TANAKA.

sen.j: 弟直吉の子孫は浅野氏（広島藩か赤穂藩などの分家かは不明）に仕えたという。
sen.e: The descendants of younger brother Naoyoshi served under ASANO Family (is uncertain whether it's Hiroshima or Ako Han branch family).
The descendants of the younger brother, Naoyoshi, served the ASANO family (though it is uncertain whether it was a branch family).
sen.cmt: Added 'the'Deleted 'under''is uncertain whether it's Hiroshima or Ako Han branch family'→'though it is uncertain whether it was a branch family' ― closer to Japanese original
sen.e: The descendants of the younger brother, Naoyoshi, served the ASANO Clan (though it is uncertain whether it was a branch Clan).
